{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QIt still has the same three translational degrees of freedom as the monatomic gas, but it can also rotate around two axes and vibrate along its single bond.\\E$"}
{"rule":"MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_US","sentence":"^\\QFor example a monatomic gas has three degrees of freedom because the atoms can move in any combination of three dimensions but has no meaningful rotation, and there is no vibration because there are no bonds which can vibrate.\\E$"}
